section.condition: TITLE=Trade Services: Issued Letter of Indemnity;PERM=li_access
section.para: This (or simply Letter of Indemnity) module enables you, on behalf of your company (the applicant), to initiate Letter of Indemnity (LOI or LI) requests, submit them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them.

section.title: Letters of Indemnity
section.para: The Letter of Indemnity is often used in Energy & Commodities (particularly Oil) trade transactions to allow the consignee to take delivery of goods without presenting the Bill of Lading (B/L) , which may have been delayed.

In the Oil business, goods often change hands during the course of the shipment in such a way that the B/L has not yet been passed to the previous intermediary in the chain. To retrieve the goods, the next consignee must therefore produce such a letter to the current shipper (company undertaking the transport of the goods). The format of the LOI should be mutually acceptable to both parties and should include title of the cargo, indemnity against non-production of documents such as the B/L, right to deliver bills, legal cost, governing law, and an obligation to put the receiver of the indemnity to funds.

From a point of view, the Letter of Indemnity is very similar to the Shipping Guarantee. The main differences are that the latter is more specifically used for global trade rather for Energy & Commodities and the Shipping Company usually submits the form to be countersigned by the bank. In some cases, the LOI can also be issued by the seller towards the buyer.

section.title: Flow of a LOI
section.para: The life cycle of a Letter of Indemnity generally starts with a request from a customer of the bank asking for its issuance. There is no structured standardized communications from client to bank, and bank to client on a LOI, but such communications may happen and are supported in , by the Message to Bank LI feature at the client and the Bank Reporting feature at the bank.

The LOI generally ends with the submission to the bank of some details or documents implying the cancellation of the Letter of Indemnity (for example,. the presentation of the Bill of Lading). This cancellation may happen automatically once required documents are presented under the Letter of Credit (LC) for which the bank acts as the Issuing Bank.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: Enter the desired terms of a new Letter of Indemnity and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.
Search for existing FTs based on specific search criteria.

section.title: LI Initiation
section.para: This section describes the LI Initiation part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: LI Initiation Functions
section.para: This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to request an Issued Letter of Indemnity.

section.title: From Scratch
section.para: As described in the initiation form.

section.title: From Existing LC
section.para: Create a Letter of Indemnity initiation from an existing Import Letter of Credit or Issued Standby Letter of Credit. This is typically where your company is the buyer and you are requesting an LI in favour of the shipper.

This function displays a list of your company's existing Import Letters of Credit and Issued Standby Letters of Credit. "Existing" means those that have been approved by the bank. The two types can be distinguished by the product code that the system ID starts with - LC for an Import Letter of Credit, and SI for an Issued Standby Letter of Credit.
Click in the System ID column to display an input form. It is similar to the one for From Scratch, but initialised with the data from the existing Letter of Credit, and with some extra fields.

section.title: From Existing EL
section.para: Create a Letter of Indemnity initiation from an existing Export Letter of Credit or Received Standby Letter of Credit. This is typically where your company is the seller and you are requesting an LOI in favour of the buyer.

This function displays a list of your company's existing Export Letters of Credit and Received Standby Letters of Credit. "Existing" means those that have been approved by the bank. The two types can be distinguished by the product code that the system ID starts with - EL for an Export Letter of Credit, and SR for a Received Standby Letter of Credit.
Click in the System ID column to display an input form. It is similar to the one for From Scratch, but initialised with the data from the existing Letter of Credit, and with some extra fields.

section.title: Edit Transactions
section.para: Review, complete and submit records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Trade services > Issued Letter of Indemnity page, it allows a LI request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Review and submit records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

When selected, this option will present a list of LI requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: Message to Bank Functions
section.para: This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to send a free-format message to the Issuing Bank.
A typical use is to reply to a notification of discrepancies on documents presented to the Issuing Bank, or to the acceptance of a draft.

listitem.para: This option displays a list of existing LIs issued to your company.

Review and submit LI records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity/Applicant Name, Beneficiary Name, Bank Reference, Our Reference, Ccy or Related Reference fields.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: Pending LI
section.para: This function will display a list of all LI records that have not been approved by the bank and the ones that are in draft state.

section.title: Pending LI - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Pending LI function, from the tool bar, select Trade Services > Issued Letter of Indemnity. Then select Pending LIs from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Pending LI Transactions
section.para: To use the Pending LI function, after selecting Trade Services > Issued Letter of Indemnity from the toolbar, click on Pending LI on the left side navigation menu. These Issued Letter of Indemnity transactions can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Entity/Applicant Name, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, Ccy or Related Reference fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: LI Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain LI records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: LI Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all LIs and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now set an entity for the LI by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: LI Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a LI record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: LI Maintenance - Action Required
section.para: List all LIs which require an action by customers. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click System ID to open and create a free format LI message for the action required.

section.title: LI Maintenance - Unsigned LIs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) LI transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: LI Maintenance - Purged LIs
section.para: List and optionally delete LI transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: LI Maintenance - Rejected LIs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of LI records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
